title: Polynomial End Behavior - degree and sign

content.question: ​The polynomial function <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> is given by <math alttext="f open parentheses x close parentheses equals a x to the power of b"><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mi>a</mi><msup><mi>x</mi><mi>b</mi></msup></math>, where <math alttext="a"><mi>a</mi></math> is an integer and <math alttext="b"><mi>b</mi></math> is a positive integer. It is known that <math alttext="limit as x rightwards arrow negative infinity of f open parentheses x close parentheses equals negative infinity"><munder><mi>lim</mi><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mo>-</mo><mo>∞</mo></mrow></munder><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mo>∞</mo></math> and <math alttext="limit as x rightwards arrow infinity of f open parentheses x close parentheses equals negative infinity"><munder><mi>lim</mi><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mo>∞</mo></mrow></munder><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mo>∞</mo></math> . Which of the following statements must be true?

choices.label: ​The value of <math alttext="a"><mi>a</mi></math> must be positive, because as <math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math> increases without bound or decreases without bound, the end behaviors of <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> are the same.

​​The value of <math alttext="a"><mi>a</mi></math> must be negative, because as <math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math> increases without bound or decreases without bound, the end behaviors of <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> are different.

​The value of <math alttext="b"><mi>b</mi></math> must be even, because as <math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math> increases without bound or decreases without bound, the end behaviors of <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> are the same.

​​The value of <math alttext="b"><mi>b</mi></math> must be odd, because as <math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math> increases without bound or decreases without bound, the end behaviors of <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> are different.

content.answer: ​The value of <math alttext="b"><mi>b</mi></math> must be even, because as <math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math> increases without bound or decreases without bound, the end behaviors of <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> are the same.
